pull.title: guix: pass `--with-newlib` to gcc-sans-libc build
pull.body:
When building our initial libc-less gcc, we can pass `--with-newlib`,
which ensures `inhibit_libc` is defined, and better indicates our
intent.

This is somewhat related to, but doesn't solve #22458. 

Co-authored-by: Carl Dong <contact@carldong.me>
Co-authored-by: Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com>

verification.payload:
tree 5ffc0b09b093eb84ccfde3750b7d38c2b9260c08
parent 9155f9b7af22a9c97cbeee461f5bbd9217adb56d
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1659440681 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1659518867 +0100

guix: pass additional options to gcc-sans-libc build

When building our initial libc-less gcc, we can pass `--with-newlib`,
which ensures `inhibit_libc` is defined, and better indicates our
intent.

Co-authored-by: Carl Dong <contact@carldong.me>
Co-authored-by: Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com>

events.message:
guix: pass additional options to gcc-sans-libc build

When building our initial libc-less gcc, we can pass `--with-newlib`,
which ensures `inhibit_libc` is defined, and better indicates our
intent.

Co-authored-by: Carl Dong <contact@carldong.me>
Co-authored-by: Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com>

> This is somewhat related to, but doesn't solve https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22458.

Closing in favour of a different solution.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -87,9 +92,9 @@ http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/hlfs/view/development/chapter05/gcc-pass1.html"
   (let* ((xbinutils (cross-binutils target))
          ;; 1. Build a cross-compiling gcc without targeting any libc, derived
          ;; from BASE-GCC-FOR-LIBC
-         (xgcc-sans-libc (cross-gcc target
+         (xgcc-sans-libc (cross-gcc-with-newlib (cross-gcc target
comments.body:
Our goal, as it's been stated in the comment above, is to
> Build a cross-compiling gcc without targeting any libc

But [`newlib`](https://www.sourceware.org/newlib/) _is_ a libc implementation.
